intro: Bisetaria, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Bisetaria is often found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
